turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: Whoa, Elizabeth. A little hostile, there. Maybe you should be the one in therapy. Then Mom and Dad can pay someone two hundred dollars an hour to listen to all of your thoughts... so we won't have to.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Maybe you'd like to tell Mom and Dad why you stopped taking your medication.

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: It's called "The Philosophy of Time Travel".

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: What does time travel have to do with philosophy?

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: Guess who wrote it?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: So I hear you have a girlfriend.

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: What's her name?

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: You're not gonna tell Mom, are you?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Why would I tell Mom?

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: Because you tell Mom everything.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: No I don't.  She worries about you.

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: Well, don't worry... I'm taking my medication.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: It's not that. I mean mouthing off to your teachers. I'll admit... when Dad told me what you said to Ms. Farmer, I laughed my ass off.

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: I was just being honest.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Yeah... well, that's not the way the world works. If you keep being too honest, the world will eventually find a way to destroy you.

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: Her name is Gretchen.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: That's a nice name.  OK, let me see it.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I got in. I'm going to Harvard.

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: Congratulations.

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: Mom and Dad won't be back until Sunday night. It's Halloween Carnival. We should throw a party. We could totally get away with it.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Okay, but it has to be a small one.

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: Everything is going to be just fine.

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: How much are they paying you to be here?

turns.speaker: JIM CUNNINGHAM
turns.text: Excuse me? What's your name, son?

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: Gerald.

turns.speaker: JIM CUNNINGHAM
turns.text: Well, Gerald, I think you're afraid.

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: Well, Jim, I think you're full of shit!

turns.speaker: JIM CUNNINGHAM
turns.text: I think you are afraid to ask me for advice. I think that you are a very troubled... confused young man. I think you're searching for answers in all the wrong places.

turns.speaker: DONNIE
turns.text: Well, I think you're the fucking Anti-Christ.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Thank you for seeing us... We... just felt that it was time to discuss...

turns.speaker: DR. THURMAN
turns.text: What I think is going on with your son.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Well, you know about his past. And when you said to look for signs of aggression... He was recently suspended from school for insulting his gym teacher.

turns.speaker: DR. THURMAN
turns.text: Has your son ever told you about Frank?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Come again?

turns.speaker: DR. THURMAN
turns.text: Frank... the giant bunny rabbit?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Frank?

turns.speaker: DR. THURMAN
turns.text: Donnie is experiencing what is commonly called a daylight hallucination.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're telling me my son has an imaginary friend?

turns.speaker: DR. THURMAN
turns.text: He has described lengthy conversations... physical encounters with what I believe to be a manifestation of his subconscious mind.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I... What can we do?

turns.speaker: DR. THURMAN
turns.text: I would like to put him through more hypnotherapy... and increase his medication.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: If that's what you think is necessary.

turns.speaker: DR. THURMAN
turns.text: But let me remind you that this treatment is... experimental.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Our son just called me a bitch.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You're not a bitch.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: So let me get this straight. No airline will claim ownership of the engine. So we have to wait for the FAA to decide who fixes my roof.  Fuck that. We're taking the money out of savings.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You are entering a new dimension of sight and sound...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Frankie Feedler. You remember him from high school?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: He was a year ahead of us?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: He died, remember? On the way to the prom.  He was doomed.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I haven't been accepted yet, mother.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: If you think Michael Dukakis will provide for this country prior to the point when you decide to squeeze one out, then I think you're misinformed.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Donnie? You're a dick.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Did you just call me a fuck-ass?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: That's enough.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You can suck a fuck.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: No. I took a year off to be with you.  Of course I care. Don't get angry.  What?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: How did you know --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I didn't realise it was such a big deal.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: It is a big deal.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I caught him flushing pills down the toilet. He knows you check the container.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Here are the keys to the Taurus. There's plenty of groceries in the fridge. And I left money on the kitchen table. And don't forget...

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Don't worry, Mom. Just go, you'll miss your flight.

turns.speaker: LEROY
turns.text: I got twelve classrooms full of water. All coming from a busted water main.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLE
turns.text: What else?

turns.speaker: LEROY
turns.text: What else? Shit, Principal Cole, you ain't gonna believe what else.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLE
turns.text: Christ. Is that an axe?

turns.speaker: LEROY
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLE
turns.text: How did this happen?

turns.speaker: LEROY
turns.text: I guess they made him do it.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Excuse me... but what is the real issue here? The PTA doesn't ban books from school.

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: The PTA is here to acknowledge that there is pornography in our school's curriculum.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Do you even know who Graham Greene is?

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: I think we've all seen "Bonanza".

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Kitty, I don't know what to say. They've suspended him for two days.  Ever since this jet fiasco, I honestly don't know what has gotten into him.

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: Rose, I'll tell you this because our daughters have been on dance team together for two years and I respect you as a WOMAN. But after witnessing your son's behaviour today, I have... significant doubts...  Our paths through life must be righteous. I urge you to go home and look in the mirror and pray that your son does not succumb to the path of fear.

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: Rose.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Kitty...

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: Rose, we have a crisis.  I am sure that you are aware of the horrible allegations against Jim Cunningham.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yes, I saw the news. Something about a kiddie-porn dungeon.

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: Please! Don't say those words.  Well... as you can see... many of us are devastated by this news. This is obviously some kind of conspiracy meant to destroy an innocent man. And I have taken it upon myself to spearhead the Jim Cunningham defence campaign. But unfortunately my civic duties have created a conflict of interest... which involves you.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Beg pardon?

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: Rose... I have to appear at his arraignment tomorrow morning. And as you know, the girls also leave for Los Angeles tomorrow morning. Now, as their coach... I was the obvious choice to chaperone them on the trip.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: But now you can't go.

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: Yes. And believe me, of all the other mothers I would never dream of asking you, given the predicament with your son. But none of the other mothers are able to go.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Oh, Kitty, I don't know. This is so last-minute... Eddie is in New York...

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: Rose... I don't know if you realise how great an opportunity this is for our daughters. This has been a dream of ours for a long time.  Sometimes I doubt your commitment to Sparkle Motion.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLE
turns.text: Kitty, I would appreciate... if you could wait...

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: Mr. Cole... not only am I a TEACHER... but I am also a PARENT of a Middlesex child. Therefore, I am the ONLY person here who transcends the parent-teacher bridge.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLE
turns.text: Kitty...

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: The bottom line... Mr. Cole... is that there is material being taught to our children that is cause for this destructive behaviour.

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: And how do they do this? They FLOOD the house... by breaking through the water main!

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLE
turns.text: This meeting of the PTA was called to inform the parents of our ongoing investigation...

turns.speaker: MS. FARMER
turns.text: I AM THE PTA! And I say that this FILTH is directly related to this vandalism.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Chut up!

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Go back to China, bitch!

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Maybe Martha Moo finally went nuts and hijacked the bus.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: You know, there's, like, this rule. We get to go home at 7:55.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: There's no rule!

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Fuck yeah there is! If the bus doesn't show up in thirty minutes, you're supposed to go straight home.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: All right! 7:55. Everybody goes home.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Let's go to Donnie's house. His parents are both at work.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: What is this shit?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Raspberry.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Wicked.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: No more fuckin' for her.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Smurfette doesn't fuck.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Bullshit. Smurfette fucks all the other smurfs. That's why Papa Smurf made her, 'cause the other smurfs were getting too horny.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Not Vanity. He's a homo.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: We got eggs, water balloons, and a dozen rolls of toilet paper.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: I stole four beers from my dad.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Is Mom okay?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: She's alive, sweetie.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Where is she?!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: She's right over there.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Mommmm! I'll be right behind you in the hearse!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Don't let that worry you, Annette!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You're what?!

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I -- I'm quittin' the pageant.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I heard you, I was just tryin' to scare you into changin' your mind. Oh for Chrissakes, Amber, the woman clung to your tap shoes while flyin' through the air like a Goddamn lawn dart!

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Oh God, I'm dead...

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: So, what do I say?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Simple. Just say, "Mom, I know you sacrificed everything -- relationships, dreams -- your tummy, ass and thighs -- all to bring me into this world. All so I could have tap lessons and be in the pageant -- the same one you were in. But, y'know what? I'm quittin'." There. Easy as pie.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Oh my God. I'm so dead...

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Yeah, you betcha...

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Hell-no, she ain't quittin'.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: No. Mom said if I did, she'd look up my dad and marry him.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: "Once a carnie, always a carnie."

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Oh-yah.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: That was your mom. She wanted you to have this.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Really, Loretta?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You-betcha.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: My mom wanted me to have this?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Oh, shut up. I thought it might help you get some sleep.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Loretta, never have kids.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Well God-love-ya for thinkin' I still could.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Oh, Mom's okay. They're just givin' her a ride back. She almost blew outta the back of Loretta's pick-up on the way over.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Thank God for bunge cords.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: ...Yah -- well, at least, y'know, I got to perform. And Mom got to see me.  I guess number eight only worked for Diane Sawyer...

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: What is wrong with you?

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I don't know. I just didn't wanna win like this.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You stop right there. You are a good person. Good things happen to good people.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: No. It's pure bullshit, sweetie. You're lucky as hell, so you might as well enjoy it. Let's get you a root beer float.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Do you guys want some shots? I'm buyin'.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I never liked her, but she didn't deserve to die in the belly of a swan like that. The whole thing's just kinda sad and lame at the same time.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: This came for you, sweetie.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Ah! It's from State! Oh my God!

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: It's all the stuff I get to do. Oh my God, oh my God... Okay, okay... We get a "personal consultation" with a make-up artist -- Eeeh! Okay, um, there'll be a choreographer to the stars and, oh no -- No way. Oh... My... God!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: What? For chrissakes, spit it out.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I'll be stayin' overnight at... The Airport Howard Johnsons!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Right by the airport -- Oh, Amber...

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: There's an indoor swimming pool! Ahhhh!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: All right, say "Airport Ho-Jo."

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Airport Ho-Jo!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I got it! Yeah, why don't ya take a...

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Loretta, don't do that.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I'm sorry. They're just starin'.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I gotta work with these women.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Okay, sweetie, that's all right. Let's go. Let's go.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I just, I just can't believe it. I'm Minnesota's American Teen Princess!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Our baby's going to Nationals! Lincoln, Alabama -- look out!

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I'm gonna be on TV! Just like Diane Sawyer.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Oh, Amber...

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I -- I -- I -- I -- I --, j-uh-j-uh- just wanted to compe-e-e-e-ete.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I can't believe this is happenin'. I can't believe she said you couldn't...

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Amber? Here.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: "Here," wh-wh-what?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: My jacket. Take it 'cause, y'know, I got my costume okay'd before the pageant. You can wear it.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Shut up, yous guys. Look, Amber, I'm not gonna win. And let's be honest, a family only needs one "Liza" and you know Peter's got much better legs than me.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Your parents'd kill you.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Oh c'mon, I love 'em, but you know they only had me 'cause Peter needed a kidney.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Lis, I want to, I really do, but... Oh, I can't.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Then do it for Peter. Mrs. Leeman used to call him a "skinny little fag" when he'd bag her groceries. He'd pop his Nancy-belt if his old jacket somehow, I don't know, got her back.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Yah?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Oh-you-beccha.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I'm lucky I have an after-school job where I can practice my talent.

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: Oh, yeah, sure. You know, every pageant is special, but this one is extra-special to me. When I was seventeen, I don't know if you know this, but I was crowned Mount Rose's American Teen Princess. And this year... drum roll please, my lovely daughter, Rebecca Ann Leeman is competin'.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Mrs. Leeman?

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I -- I'm wearin' this costume. I'm, uh, I'm gonna do my talent tonight.

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: Oh really -- I don't think so.  Uh, Amber, I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but rules state that a costume must be okay'd at least a week in advance. And this...  This is why we have the rule. My goodness gracious, I couldn't allow a neckline this low on stage. We have kids in the audience.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: But, you -- I mean... It's not my fault. I -- I... Please? I didn't do anything wrong...

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Sorry. I just thought she might not wanna meet her Maker lookin' like a cheap whore.

turns.speaker: MR. LARSON
turns.text: Well, your "cheap whore" is this family's "lovin' mother."  The Clemens said to make him look like he just came from snowmobilin'. Pink cheeks, and...

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: -- red nose and ears. I know, I know.

turns.speaker: MR. LARSON
turns.text: Amber...

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: No, don't say it. Another stray bullet to the head.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I'm gonna need more caps.

turns.speaker: MR. LARSON
turns.text: You hafta go home. There's some kinda emergency at the trailer park.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Relax, that's my ma's code for, "Bring home milk and a carton-a Luckys."

turns.speaker: MR. LARSON
turns.text: No. Loretta called. There's been a... a fire.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: ...Yah -- 1963. Her beauty worked against her when she started as a reporter in Louisville, her hometown. Those were different times.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Hey, Amber, y'get my smokes?

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: That's my mom.  I'll get 'em in a sec.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Oh shit!

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: They're from L.A. They wanted to see my room and film me for their movie.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Oh... How quickly they grow up.  Hey, if they ask you to take off your shirt, get the money first.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Oh, Mom, it's so ugly.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Ruined a brand-new pair of Lee Press- ons.  Well, I sat down for a beer and KA- BLEWEY! Next thing I know, somethin' blows through my kitchen window. Next thing I know, I'm ass up in Loretta's flower bed.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Go on! Get out!

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Mom, look, don't say anything. First of all, I'm not pregnant.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Mom!

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I ain't lettin' go ktil you tell me what's up. I'm reaching' a point where I'd kill someone for the nicotine on their fingernails.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Okay. Yesterday I... I got this picture. So I kinda, y'know, I'm thinkin' no. I'm gonna, I -- I -- I'm gonna quit the pageant.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Ow!

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Would yous boys excuse us a second? Loretta, you too.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Nice mouth you got there, Mom, but I -- I'm not goin' through this again.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You're not goin' through this again? You? You're not the one who knows how Jiffy Pop feels.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Oh, c'mon... First the picture of Tammy, then Brett Clemens, now this? It's scary.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Let me tell you "scary," Amber. Look at me. Do you wanna look like you been rode hard and put away wet at my age? I'm a "lifer" here. Best I can hope for is to end up in a descent "raisin ranch" where they'll change me twice a day.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: That's it, I'm goin'...

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Honest to God, if I got to do it over? I'd start walkin' outta this town the minute I took my first step. Practically the only thing I wouldn't do different is have you...

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: God I hope that's you and not your concussion talkin'.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: It's me... I just don't want this to be the thing you'd do over. This pageant's your ticket outta here. I know you can win, Amber.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: C'mere. I love you so much.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I love you much.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Bye mom.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: We was robbed.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Okay, okay!  Listen-up. Coupla notes from last night's dress rehearsal.  Number one, Gladys says a coupla yous are gettin' sexy with your hips durin' the "Physical Fitness" routine...

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Oh my God! My -- my tap costume's gone.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Uh, Amber? We're not puttin' on our Talent costumes. You need to put on your "Physical Fitness" outfit. And let's shake a leg, ladies.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: No, wait. It -- it was here before the openin' number... wait. What am I sayin'? I should just ask you, Becky. Where is it?

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I hate her!

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: We all do. Now let's go.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Mrs. Clark, why are you doing this to me? Why're you pretendin' you don't know what's goin' on?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Amber, I'm sorry. I really am. But you know the rules. All talent costumes hafta be okay'd by Gladys before the pageant.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: But, doesn't someone taking your costume so you can't compete, overrule that rule?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Sorry. I -- I don't make the rules.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: This, this... This is bullshit!

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Amber Atkins! That is not American Teen Princess language!

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Good, 'cause this isn't an American Teen Princess Pageant -- it's, it's Nazi Germany!

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: What're you doin' here?

turns.speaker: BECKY
turns.text: Oh, Amber, like you're the only one who visits Mary.

turns.speaker: BECKY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: You heard me. Where is it?

turns.speaker: BECKY
turns.text: If you're gettin' at somethin', you better just say it.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I just did.

turns.speaker: BECKY
turns.text: Well then, you better be willin' to back it up, 'cause you're talkin' like crazy.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Oh -- oh, you bring me some of that snotty attitude, Becky -- bring it on.

turns.speaker: BECKY
turns.text: Well, as my mother says at Sunday dinner, "Come and get it," bitch!

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Oh, I'll "get it." I'll "get it" all right. I might even take seconds.

turns.speaker: BECKY
turns.text: If you want seconds, then I'll make sure it's hot enough for ya.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Bitch!

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Here, I didn't get any.

turns.speaker: LESLIE
turns.text: Here, have some.

turns.speaker: LESLIE
turns.text: So, anyone talk to Janelle?

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Yah -- I brought her some flowers this morning. She's in the room next to my mom. She's super happy.

turns.speaker: LESLIE
turns.text: Amber, if I die from these fumes, will you be sure to cover the hickies on my neck?

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: LESLIE
turns.text: And the bite marks on my ears?

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: LESLIE
turns.text: I know it doesn't matter, but on my inner thighs.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Yes, Leslie!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Hi...

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Here, I'll take it. It's my job.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: NO...  It's all right. I got it. Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Oh man, you got leutefisk in your hair.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Then it must be Wednesday.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: So, uh, I -- I'm not really busy Friday. I just said that -- y'know.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: So if, uh, you wanted to do somethin'...

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Well, uh, I'm cuttin' out early today to do a little duck huntin'... but, uh, maybe I could call you tonight.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Yah-sure, fine... fine.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Okay... well, bye.

turns.speaker: AMBER
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: What do you mean, they take out her butt?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Oh, Jesus H. Christ!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Are we on "Cops" again?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You could be quiet.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: It's just the guys that are... you know, makin' the movie about the pageant. I told you about 'em.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Oh, naw. Hi.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: This here's Loretta.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I tell Annette, I says, "You talk to me durin' my stories, you might as well be talkin' to the wall."  You guys want a beer?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Say, yous boys been to the Leeman's?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Loretta, shut it.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Y'know, if you have, you got all the pictures of the winner you need.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Shut it up, Loretta.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Oh, Christ, it's true.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Let's just say who should win, who deserves to win is Amber.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Why don't you paint a big red target on your ass, Loretta.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: She's the prettiest, y'know. The best damn tapper. The most smartest...

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: "Most smartest?" Oh, that's good, Loretta. Make sure you get a picture of that. "Most smartest." We're cuttin you off and sendin' you home.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Well, excuse me, Annette, but I'm braggin' up your kid, here.  Amber's gonna be the next Diane Sawyer, y'know...

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I'll be right back. See ya later.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: They're makin' a movie, here, goddamn it.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: All right, they're makin' a movie.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You don't know where this is gonna...

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I got a hairdo.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Don't fall for it. She lives two trailers down.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: So? Be real easy.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Go on home, Loretta. Come on. Go on, the party's over.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Anyone?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Oh-Jesus-Mary-n-Joseph, she's pregnant!  If you are -- come back, sweetie. Mommy wants to talk, then KILL YOU!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Annette, why don't you just see if there's any beer left in that can and relax a bit.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: We was robbed.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Okay. Take her purse.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Annette, just use your hand.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: They told me to practice.

turns.speaker: BECKY
turns.text: Well, it's all happenin' so fast. Goodness-gracious, it hardly seems real, y'know? I mean, I won! I'm the winner! I'm going to State!

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: She's the winner and we're going to state.

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: C'mon, Rebecca, you wanted it. Now get up there. Ride it side-saddle if you have to -- like a horse. C'mon, now.

turns.speaker: BECKY
turns.text: It smells funny. Like gasoline.

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: Oh for chrissakes, everything smells like that in Mexico.

turns.speaker: BECKY
turns.text: My dress'll reek.

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: Listen, little missy, this cost your dad a pretty penny. Now get your ass up there and show me some teeth.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: I'm a mirror.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Correction. This spunky monkey on my right is Terry Macey. And we are your Minnesota American Teen Princess State Board.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: We're also the co-founders of the Minnesota Modeling Academy. Applications are at the tiki bar. We'll wave the fifty dollar application fee if you list a friend and put her address.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Mm-hm.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: People, people -- wait, wait a minute, here. Uh, while we haven't ruled out sabotage from neighboring state pageants -- Iowa, Wisconsin, North Dakota...

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Dakota.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Ohio...

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: That bitch from...

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Wisconsin.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: All right, then.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: The bitch.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: The important thing is that we have a winner...

turns.speaker: DOCUMENTARIAN
turns.text: Do you think that most people would say that teenage beauty pageants are a good idea?

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: Oh yah-sure, I know what some of your big city, no bra wearin', hairy- legged women's libbers say, "Pageants are old-fashioned" and, uh, and "demeaning" to the girls --

turns.speaker: DOCUMENTARIAN
turns.text: So what was the theme of the pageant last year?

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: Last year? It was, "Buy American."

turns.speaker: DOCUMENTARIAN
turns.text: And the year before that?

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: "U.S.A. is A-okay."

turns.speaker: DOCUMENTARIAN
turns.text: Can you remember the theme of your favorite pageant?

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: "Can I? I'm Amer-I-Can!" People ask me where I get this. I don't know, it's... maybe a gift from God or somethin'.

turns.speaker: FRY GIRL #1
turns.text: ...Oh, yeah-right. I ain't gonna be in no goddamn pageant! Look what happened to that dork-ass farm girl.

turns.speaker: PREGNANT FRY GIRL
turns.text: Tammy Curry?

turns.speaker: FRY GIRL #1
turns.text: Yah -- yah. Everyone says this is a big accident? She got iced because she wins everything, and this time someone didn't want her to win.

turns.speaker: PREGNANT FRY GIRL
turns.text: This pageant's like a roach motel.

turns.speaker: FRY GIRL #1
turns.text: Girls check in, but they don't check out.

turns.speaker: PREGNANT FRY GIRL
turns.text: Yeah. And they say smokin' is bad for your health.

turns.speaker: FRY GIRL #1
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: FRY GIRL #1
turns.text: What a surprise. Gladys Leeman's finally gonna go to State. And she'll probably ride on Becky's ass all the way to Nationals, too.

turns.speaker: PREGNANT FRY GIRL
turns.text: I wonder how she's gonna fix that one.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: ...You betcha. S'posed to be colder- n-a witches tit tonight...

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: Oh, Lester. He loves his weather, y'know.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Hey, ya like it? Open it... Yah -- the globe. Pull at the equator there.

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: We're not in the showroom, Dear.

turns.speaker: GLADYS
turns.text: Lester?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Oh, all right  How soon they forget where all this comes from.
